result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Beau Anthony Mucha in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nancy Bergstrom appears on behalf of the guardianship.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Deft assessment has been complete waiting for results.  Nancy addresses the court in touch Adult Protective Services.  Guardianship should be filed in Marathon County.  Waiting on the Doctors report.  Mindy(from the home)  will contact APS to get the necessary papwork  Review scheduled for March 28, 2016.
from the Court to N. L. Bergstrom
on competency - signed by the court

Defendant Beau Anthony Mucha in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called and appearances given.  State does not object to Dr Galli report. Defense agrees with the report.  Guardianship proceedings and protective placement should start on behalf of the deft.   Court addresses the parties.   Court tries to find out how to start the guardianship and placement.  The mother, father and brother do not want to be the guardian of the deft.  Court to suspend the criminal proceedings at this time.  Defense will followup.  Court enters an order for treatment.

Defendant, Beau Anthony Mucha appeared with Team Leader from Group Home - Gabrich .  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes the request for a competency hearing (father does not that the son is competent to stand trial)  Deft has a protective payee, deft is his own guardian at this time.  Court questions Gabrich.  She feels that he not competent to proceed. Court questions the deft.  Court to order a competency evaluation.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Beau Anthony Mucha in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised.  Not guilty plea entered Bond set  
Father makes a statement to the court.  Manager of the group home speaks.

  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:00 am.
